paper_abstract: Inferences about speech acts are often conditional, non-monotonic, and involve the issue of time. Most agent communication languages, however, ignore these issues, due to the difficulty to combine them in a single formalism. This paper addresses such issues in defeasible logic, and shows how to express a semantics for ACLs in order to make non-monotonic inferences on the basis of speech acts. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier B.V.
paper_title: Time and defeasibility in FIPA ACL semantics
